Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: pijul
Description: A distributed version control system that is at the same time theoretically sound, fast and easy to learn and use

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Adds a path to the tree

Arguments.Name: --deps-only
Arguments.Description: Only apply the dependencies of the change, not the change itself. Only applicable for a single change

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: archive
Arguments.Description: Creates an archive of the repository

Arguments.Name: --change
Arguments.Description: Apply these changes after switching to the channel

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Use this channel, instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Do not check certificates (HTTPS remotes only, this option might be dangerous)

Arguments.Name: --prefix
Arguments.Description: Append this path in front of each path inside the archive

Arguments.Name: --remote
Arguments.Description: Ask the remote to send an archive

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --umask
Arguments.Description: Append this path in front of each path inside the archive

Arguments.Name: change
Arguments.Description: Shows information about a particular change

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Use the repository at PATH instead of the current directory

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete a channel. The channel must not be the current channel

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

Arguments.Name: switch
Arguments.Description: Switch to a channel. There must not be unrecorded changes in the working copy

Arguments.Name: --change
Arguments.Description: Clone this change and its dependencies

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Do not check certificates (HTTPS remotes only, this option might be dangerous)

Arguments.Name: credit
Arguments.Description: Shows which change last affected each line of the given file(s)

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Use this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Output the diff in JSON format instead of the default change text format

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Show a short version of the diff

Arguments.Name: --tag
Arguments.Description: Add all the changes of this channel as dependencies (except changes implied transitively), instead of the minimal dependencies

Arguments.Name: --change
Arguments.Description: Apply this change after creating the channel

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Make the new channel from this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Set the name of the current channel (defaults to “main”)

Arguments.Name: -k
Arguments.Description: Project kind; if Pijul knows about your project kind, the .ignore file will be populated with a conservative list of commonly ignored entries. Example: pijul init --kind=rust

Arguments.Name: log
Arguments.Description: Show the entire log of changes

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Show logs for this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: --description
Arguments.Description: Include full change description in the output

Arguments.Name: --limit
Arguments.Description: Output at most this many changes

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --state
Arguments.Description: Include state identifiers in the output

Arguments.Name: pull
Arguments.Description: Pulls changes from a remote upstream

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Force an update of the local remote cache. May effect some reporting of unrecords/concurrent changes in the remote

Arguments.Name: --full
Arguments.Description: Download full changes, even when not necessary

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Do not check certificates (HTTPS remotes only, this option might be dangerous)

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --to-channel
Arguments.Description: Pull into this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: push
Arguments.Description: Pushes changes to a remote upstream

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Force an update of the local remote cache. May effect some reporting of unrecords/concurrent changes in the remote

Arguments.Name: --from-channel
Arguments.Description: Push from this channel instead of the default channel

Arguments.Name: k
Arguments.Description: Do not check certificates (HTTPS remotes only, this option might be dangerous)

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Push changes only relating to these paths

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Path to the repository. Uses the current repository if the argument is omitted

Arguments.Name: --to-channel
Arguments.Description: Push to this remote channel instead of the remote’s default channel

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Record all paths that have changed

Arguments.Name: --amend
Arguments.Description: Amend this change instead of creating a new change

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Record the change in this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

Arguments.Name: remove
Arguments.Description: Removes a file from the tree of tracked files (pijul record will then record this as a deletion)

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description:
Resets the working copy to the last recorded change.
In other words, discards all unrecorded changes

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Reset the working copy to this channel, and change the current channel to this channel

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Print this file to the standard output, without modifying the repository (works for a single file only)

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Reset even if there are unrecorded changes

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --channel
Arguments.Description: Unrecord changes from this channel instead of the current channel

Arguments.Name: --repository
Arguments.Description: Set the repository where this command should run. Defaults to the first ancestor of the current directory that contains a .pijul directory

Arguments.Name: --reset
Arguments.Description: Also undo the changes in the working copy (preserving unrecorded changes if there are any)

Arguments.Name: --show-changes
Arguments.Description: Show N changes in a text editor if no s were given. Defaults to the value of unrecord_changes in your global configuration
